title: The Beacon
text: The background of this painting is based on a photograph that I took of the Peselli Hills in Pembrokeshire, Wales. It was taken on the evening of a Strawberry Moon which had just risen over the hills and had produced an eerie light. The navigation lights on the television mast which was situated in the hills added to the haunting atmosphere.....and then some man with a dog on his head and a puppy on his lap came cycling into the scene!

title: Android
text: This painting is based on a photo that I took of my granddaughter, Kiera. We were on a family holiday in Linton, Yorkshire, England, and we'd just finished a barbeque. It was twilight and Kiera had just borrowed her mom's Android mobile phone to play a game and I was captivated by the light.

title: Rest In Peace
text: This picture is based on the otherworldly setting of the Ffynone Falls in Pembrokeshire, Wales. There just happened to be a few people lying around sleeping at the tine. Or were they?

title: Ghost of Old Park Hill
text: Based on a photograph of the newly refurbished iconic Park Hill flats in Sheffield, this painting imagines past residents as ghosts revisiting and stirring up past memories.

title: One For Sorrow
text: This drawing is based on a photograph I took of the trig point obelisk on top of Kinver Edge, Staffordshire, England. it was taken on a misty Autumn day and the atmosphere was quite melancholic. A corvid landed on top of the obelisk and I was reminded of the Magpie nursery rhyme  One for sorrow, two for joy.....

title: Death
text: This is the one & only acrylic painting that I have done (the paint just dries way too quickly).It is a painting of a dead tree in Chances Wood, Kinver, Staffordshire, England. I wastaken with its majesty even in death.

title: It's a Halfpenny Green Moon
text: This is a portrait of a lovely lady, Emily Edwards. A friend from the village who has recently lost a long & courageous battle wuth cancer. It is based on a photograph taken by her son Ted which was posted on Facebook. I saw it and was taken by the sheer joy it exuded. I asked Emily if I could paint it and she kindly agreed. The photo was taken on an Autumn evening in front of a bonfire. The moon had just come out and Emily was drinking a pint of Halfpenny Green cider. She was very happy.
